title: Marlborough hospital evacuated after ‘Code Black’ shutdown
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: UMass Memorial Marlborough campus evacuated over 70 patients due to heating and water system failures.
A large valve break caused system failures, prompting a 'Code Black' and halting new ambulance arrivals.
Marlborough Campus closed for inpatient services; walk-in emergencies open, outpatient services mostly rescheduled.

title: Patriots rookie Kyle Williams chased down a streaker at Super Bowl LX
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots rookie Kyle Williams stopped a field intruder during the fourth quarter of Super Bowl LX against the Seahawks.
The streaker, arrested by Santa Clara Police, is facing charges of trespassing and field intrusion.
Williams recorded a 4.40-second 40-yard dash at the NFL Combine, showcasing his speed on and off the field.

title: Offseason primer: Here’s a quick look at Patriots’ list of 2026 draft picks, pending free agents
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: The Patriots hold 11 picks in the 2026 NFL Draft, including first-round pick number 31.
New England has over $42 million in cap space with several players facing free agency, including TE Austin Hooper.
The NFL Scouting Combine starts February 23, and the 2026 free agency period begins March 11.

title: Federal judge who said he retired to fight Trump was reportedly subject of misconduct probe
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Former U.S. District Judge Mark L. Wolf retired amid a misconduct probe alleging creation of a hostile work environment.
Chief Circuit Judge David Barron found 'probable cause' for misconduct but deemed further action unnecessary after Wolf's resignation.
Wolf, now senior counsel at Todd & Weld, resigned to speak against the Trump administration, citing threats to democracy.

title: Local obituary: Accursio ‘Gus’ Sanfilippo, 55, Gloucester fisherman and captain of the Lily Jean
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Accursio 'Gus' Sanfilippo, 55, a beloved Gloucester fisherman, passed away at sea on January 30, 2026.
Gus Sanfilippo was captain of the Lily Jean and dedicated over 40 years to the local dory racing community.
Funeral services include visiting hours at Greely Funeral Home and a Mass at St. Ann Church, Gloucester.

title: Here’s what Boston meteorologists are saying about this week’s weather, including Tuesday’s snow
author: John Waller
bullets: Snow is expected Tuesday in Southern New England, with 1-3 inches forecasted, mainly affecting the evening commute.
Higher snowfall totals of 3-6 inches are possible near and north of Route 2, according to meteorologist Kelly Ann Cicalese.
Temperatures will moderate starting Tuesday, although mixed precipitation could affect areas near the south coast, Cape, and Islands.

title: Should you be worried about your roof this winter?
author: Regina Cole
bullets: Ice dams are a major concern for New England roofs in winter, but snow itself generally acts as an insulator.
Roof damage often stems from factors like wind shears, with modern shingles designed to handle winds up to 130 mph.
Ice and water shield technology can help prevent ice dam issues but has a 30% failure rate, often due to workmanship.

title: 4 maps predicting Tuesday snowfall totals
author: John Waller
bullets: Boston anticipates 1-3 inches of snow starting late Tuesday afternoon into night.
North shore may experience higher snowfall, possibly 3-6 inches, according to meteorologists.
Snowfall will likely require cleanup efforts extending into Wednesday, affecting Northern New England more significantly.

title: ‘I just feel numb’: Inside the Patriots’ locker room after a crushing Super Bowl defeat
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots fell to Seattle Seahawks 29-13 in Super Bowl LX, resulting in palpable locker room disappointment.
Cornerback Charles Woods and safety Craig Woodson expressed frustration and numbness over the game's outcome.
Despite loss, players like Carlton Davis expressed pride in team progress and optimism for future seasons.

title: The 2025 Patriots season was a success. You can still feel sick about its ending.
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The New England Patriots lost to the Seattle Seahawks 29-13 in Super Bowl LX, ending their season with disappointment.
Patriots quarterback Drake Maye struggled under pressure, with Seattle's defense sacking him six times and forcing three turnovers.
Despite the Super Bowl loss, the Patriots exceeded expectations, progressing from a four-win season in 2024 to a strong 2025 campaign.
